messages.msgSnippet: hi Seamus, I am wanting to go and visit the one in Portland... which is where I live. I am happy with what the children and I are doing right now, but perhaps
messages.messageBody:
hi Seamus,

I am wanting to go and visit the one in Portland... which is where I live. I
am happy with what the children and I are doing right now, but perhaps when
they are older. (my oldest is 11) I am on orsig as well. under another sn...
nice to meet you.
Teri

Co-author of <A HREF="http://www.championpress.com/unschoolingmain.html">
Christian Unschooling: growing your child in the freedom of Christ</A>
Pre-order's available now!
Assistant Editor of <A HREF="http://www.egroups.com/group/Seedling">eGroups :
Seedling</A>

Christian Unschooling - Natural Learning</A>

messages.subject: Unschools in the Pacifi NW
messages.msgSnippet: There is an unschool in Seattle, WA and in Portland, OR (of which I am a staff member).  Portland is right on the Washington / Oregon border. Seattle, WA: The
messages.messageBody:
There is an unschool in Seattle, WA and in Portland, OR (of which
I am a staff member). Portland is right on the Washington /
Oregon border.

Seattle, WA:
The Clearwater School
http://www.clearwater.org/

Portland, OR
Cascade Valley School
http://www.casval.org

Both of these schools are modelled after Sudbury Valley School in
Framingham, MA.
http://www.sudval.org/

These schools follow the writings of Daniel Greenberg, John Holt,
Grace Llewellyn, and John Taylor Gatto.

Seamus





> Hello everybody
> I am Julie and i live in Manchester, England with my partner and our four
> kids. Just thought I would jump in and say Hello. I don't really have
> anything else to say right now as I am finding it hard keeping up with all
> my email (finding it hard keeping up with the kids as well!) But if
> anybody can share some of their experience with unschooling and Washington
> State laws, i'd be interested as we are considering a move. Peace Julie


---------------------------------------------------------
Seamus Mulryan
smulryan@...

Inborn processes recreate institutions to meet the
developing needs of the individual. As things now stand,
the institutions are remaking individuals to meet the
needs of the developing institutions.
-Robert, a Sudbury-model school staff member
----------------------------------------------------------
